pages.text: The $(item)Power Crucible$() is the $(thing)Essential Tool of Alchemy$(). Its unique capability to convert matter into its raw $(thing)Alchemical Power$() enables easy access to these powers.$(br2)Additionally, it acts as a medium for $(thing)Transmutation$(0) and a viable chamber for $(4)Reactions$(0).

First, the $(item)Crucible$() must be placed $(thing)In-World$(). Then, the $(item)Device$() may be filled with Water by hand. Due to the Warded Nature of its sides, $(thing)Automated Piping$() regrettably cannot access its interiors.$(br2)$(o)You can empty it with a shift right click.

When Items that bear $(thing)Power$() are added to the $(item)Crucible$(), their $(thing)Power$() is extracted. Usually, this leads to the $(thing)Existential Collapse$() of the item in question, but in certain cases a byproduct is created. $(br2)Once in the Crucible, Powers may change the color or movement of the water.

Certain combinations of Powers may react once in solution. If Particles begin to escape or surround the Crucible, that is evidence of a Reaction taking place! $(br2)A word of warning: some Reactions are hazardous to nearby creatures, including yourself.$(br2)Dissolved Power is also used to Transmute items into other items; you can see an example recipe $(l:reactive:results/stardust)here$(/l).

$(1)For the engineering-oriented: $(p)$(item)Dispensers$(1) are able to both fill and empty $(l:reactive:objects_of_study/bottles)bottles of Power$(/l) when aimed at a Crucible. $(p)A $(item)Hopper$(1) is able to autonomously add items to the Crucible, even from the sides. $(p)Finally, output items bounce out of the Crucible high enough that a stream of Water would be able to catch them.
